course.title: Machine Learning, Data Science and Deep Learning with Python
course.subtitle: Complete hands-on machine learning tutorial with data science, Tensorflow, artificial intelligence, and neural networks

reviews.body: This course provides a fairly extensive overview of machine learning techniques. The information about neural networks is also very good, but not as extensive as the ML material - but that is due to the nature of neural netwoks/deep learning. Overall, this is a great course for people with wanting to learn about machine/deep learning and who have little to no prior exposure. By the end of the course, one should have a decent grasp of various methods employed in machine learning, and should also know where/what to look for further learning. Frank gives a good lecture and provides excellent insight as one might expect from a person with his experience in the field. One point of note: if you are not familiar with Python, you may struggle a bit when following along with the examples. If you are familiar with Python, then the examples are very clear and easy to understand.
This is a perfect course for a broad introduction to the field of deep learning. I would recommend taking the course and using it as a reference/refresh tool.

I'm a data munger in the industry looking to expand my horizons. This course is actually paid for and included in our learning resources at work. It is a lot of work if you want to do it right, but worth it. I recommend it.
Good practical examples. The FinalAssesment Exercise was really a good one to assemble all the learning in one project.
Great general overview of everything you should know. Taking additional courses focusing on more detailed manner would be necessary afterwards.

Excellent introduction into Data Science and Machine Learning!

Even for someone who had some data science background, I found the course very useful.

I can't appreciate enough Frank Kane's work on designing this amazing course. I am really now well-familiar (not an expert) with the concepts we are implementing in the world of Data Science, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning.

I enrolled myself as a novice in this course with a goal to build up the basics of this amazing field of data. I can confidently say I successfully achieved my goals, however there is a way ahead to learn more.

I highly recommend this course to everyone who is interested and curious to explore what Machine Learning is.

Again! Thank you so much Frank. I am looking forward to get enrolled on other related course unders your instruction. I enjoyed the course throughout and learned a lot.

I think some learning questions or even easy programming exercises would be good to get a feeling about the level of what should be expected to take away from this course. What is expected to know after this course? Just high level or really doing all these fancy stuff?
Frank Kane is an amazing guy. He made this whole thing look a lot easier. Ethics of Deep Learning session shows his commitment to a better world. Keep going!

The course can be better improved if we can have more explanation on the codes and more exercises perhaps. I really like how the final exercise works. Hopefully we can have it in the earlier parts of the course. Nonetheless explanation of topics is very clear and easy to understand.

Good introduction how to use ML Algorithms.

I liked the Jupyter Notebooks a lot to play around.

However, I have one criticism: Not every wording coming from Mathematics is just fancy and you want to show how smart you are. And most of the Maths used for the algorithms is not really hard. Although I see that it goes beyond the course. That's why I give "only" 4 stars. Maybe you could add some notes on the maths behind.

Best,

Philipp

This is a very interesting course. It goes through many different useful techniques used nowadays for data analysis, machine learning and deep learning.

Without digging too much into theoretical aspects, it provides many practical examples in python.

instructor.name: Sundog Education by Frank Kane
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Sundog Education's mission is to make highly valuable career skills in big data, data science, and machine learning accessible to everyone in the world. Our consortium of expert instructors shares our knowledge in these emerging fields with you, at prices anyone can afford. 

Sundog Education is led by Frank Kane and owned by Frank's company, Sundog Software LLC. Frank spent 9 years at Amazon and IMDb, developing and managing the technology that automatically delivers product and movie recommendations to hundreds of millions of customers, all the time. Frank holds 17 issued patents in the fields of distributed computing, data mining, and machine learning. In 2012, Frank left to start his own successful company, Sundog Software, which focuses on virtual reality environment technology, and teaching others about big data analysis.

Due to our volume of students we are unable to respond to private messages; please post your questions within the Q&A of your course. Thanks for understanding.
